page.title: 01Gazeteer
page.content:
Surrounded by rich, gently-rolling farmland, Castle-Douglas has long been a market centre. Its present flourishing cattle market is more than a century old and is still a main centre for sales of Ayrshire and Galloway cattle. It is fortunate in having Carlingwark Loch and its shores as a civic park, which now includes a large caravan site. Boating, golf, tennis and fishing are available on the spot. Castle-Douglas is regarded as the commercial capital of the district, and it won a Saltire Society award in 1962 for its enterprise
Population 3,373
Location 54.57 N, 3.56 W.
